title: Strike a pose: standout trends from the season’s key collections – in pictures
description: This autumn, Chanel embraced retro elegance, Saint Laurent championed the tux and Celine went monochrome. Here are the top looks to inspire your winter wardrobe in part two of our collections story Continue reading...
author: Fashion editor Jo Jones Photographer Andrew Woffinden
excerpt: This autumn, Chanel embraced retro elegance, Saint Laurent championed the tux and Celine went monochrome. Here are the top looks to inspire your winter wardrobe in part two of our collections story
text: Town and countryEmbrace your Brontë heroine out on the moors, with an ankle-skimming tweed coat. Cape coat, top and knitted shorts, over-the-knee boots and bag, chloe.com Retro eleganceFrom the 20s to the 70s this trend has one thing in common, it must be glamorous. Jacket, trousers, earrings and hat, chanel.com Textural knitsChunky cable knits are this winter’s go to style. Knitted cardigan and matching skirt, alexandermcqueen.com The standout dressMatthieu Blazy set the bar for forever dresses at Bottega Veneta with this spliced dress. Dress, earrings and shoes, bottegaventeta.com Ladylike silhouettesA sheath dress is a failsafe winter wardrobe staple, choose from cashmere through to silk. Dress and shoes, fendi.com The 60s with a bow on topTwist and shout in shift dresses, mini skirts and monochrome co-ords. Hat, jacket, blouse and skirt, celine.com Architectural shirtingSculptural folds and origami lines give wardrobe staples and eye-catching spin. Top, isseymiyake.com Chintz floralSummertime blooms have stuck around, winters version are more wallpaper chintz. Leather bomber, floral trousers and shoes, loewe.com Pump up the volumeQuiet luxury may still be present, but this trend is about being anything but quiet. Oversized, bold, puffed-up and voluminous. Jumper and coat, maison-alaia.com Autumnal prints to fall forAutumn appropriate latte colours with a soft print on fluid silk. Dress and boots, hermes.com Le smoking suitThe tuxedo suit is back with clean minimalist lines replacing the LBD for evenings. Jacket, trousers and earring, ysl.com. Model Jamba at Premier Model Managaement; makeup by Dina at The Creative Artists using Skincare preparation using DrIdriss.com; hair by Richard Scorer for Haringtons Hairdressing; fashion assistants Sam Deaman and Roz Donoghue; photographers assistant Marija Vainilaviciute
